"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

"Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

Overall, these enhancements aim to improve the user experience and functionality of the Partybank platform."}

As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. Users can create aseries with descriptive metadata, assign existing events to it, and view all related events in aconsolidated dashboard.2"

{"content":"The text is a document, likely part of an assignment, that outlines the migration and enhancement of a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform called Partybank. This document, prepared by Jonathan Martins and submitted to Jasleen Sharma, details the improvements made to the platform including enhanced user security, better content organization, and increased operational flexibility. It highlights the introduction of a structured onboarding process for new and existing users, a redesigned event creation experience, and a new feature called \"Series\" to help organizers manage related events more effectively. These changes are aimed at making the platform more user-friendly and efficient for event organizers."}

It discusses the introduction of new features aimed at improving user security, content organization, and operational flexibility. The enhancements include a secure onboarding flow for new and legacy users, a redesigned event creation process with multi-step guidance and integrated ticket setup, and the introduction of a \"Series\" feature that allows organizers to group related events under a common theme. "Assignment 2CST8911 300Jonathan Martins041156688June 12, 2025Submitted to:Jasleen Sharma1Partybank Platform Migration: Enhancing Onboarding, Event Creation,and Series ManagementPartybank is a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform that helps organizers createevents, sell tickets, and track performance. As part of a system-wide migration, the platform isintroducing critical new features to improve user security, content organization, and operationalflexibility.The legacy Partybank system lacked a structured onboarding experience and did not supportaccount protection features such as passwords and PINs. To address this gap, we designed asecure onboarding flow for both new and legacy users. Features include password and PIN setupduring registration, as well as a migration process for old users using temporary credentials. Astep-by-step onboarding tracker was also introduced to guide new users through profile setup andverification.In addition, we redesigned the event creation experience. A multi-step event creation form nowguides organizers through scheduling, location setup, and ticket configuration, all within a singleflow. Ticket setup is fully integrated, allowing users to define pricing, limits, and availability inthe same interface. The \"Save as Draft\" feature ensures that organizers can return to incompleteevent setups at their convenience.Finally, to help organizers manage related events, we introduced the concept of a \"Series.\" Aseries functions like an album that groups events under a common theme. {"content":"The text is an assignment submitted by Jonathan Martins, concerning the migration of Partybank, a cloud-based event management and ticketing platform. The platform is undergoing a system-wide migration to introduce new features aimed at enhancing user security, content organization, and operational flexibility. The migration addresses the lack of a structured onboarding experience in the legacy system by introducing a secure onboarding flow, password and PIN setup, and a migration process for legacy users. Additionally, the event creation process has been redesigned to be more streamlined, integrating ticket setup within the same interface and adding a \"Save as Draft\" feature. A new feature called \"Series\" has also been introduced to help organizers manage related events under a common theme, improving the organization and visibility of events."}
